title: Cannot build tar.xz packages
body:
I have a build machine setup with gcc 7 which is not able to extract tar.xz packages. 
```
==> Staging archive: /var/build/paul/spack/var/spack/stage/gettext-0.19.8.1-4z3teabaygcrw6a6faq5baer2m3hilqd/gettext-0.19.8.1.tar.xz
xz: error while loading shared libraries: liblzma.so.5: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
/var/build/paul/spack/opt/spack/linux-scientificcernslc6-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/tar-1.30-uhlna6sdc77pjcjhqc2er7dcfav6wkqm/bin/tar: Child returned status 127
/var/build/paul/spack/opt/spack/linux-scientificcernslc6-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/tar-1.30-uhlna6sdc77pjcjhqc2er7dcfav6wkqm/bin/tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    '/var/build/paul/spack/opt/spack/linux-scientificcernslc6-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/tar-1.30-uhlna6sdc77pjcjhqc2er7dcfav6wkqm/bin/tar' '-xf' '/var/build/paul/spack/var/spack/stage/gettext-0.19.8.1-4z3teabaygcrw6a6faq5baer2m3hilqd/gettext-0.19.8.1.tar.xz'
==> Error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/build/paul/spack/var/spack/stage/gettext-0.19.8.1-4z3teabaygcrw6a6faq5baer2m3hilqd/spack-expanded-archive/spack-build.out'
```
xz is externally installed in a remote file system.
For some reason spack is unable to extract the xz archive because it fails to load the liblzma library which is inside the xz installation directory. If I manually use tar -xf to extract the archive there are no problems. Similarly, if I manually add /path/to/xz/lib to LD_LIBRARY_PATH inside compilers.yaml spack extracts the archive with no problem.

This issue seems similar to https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/315 and the only fix that I have been able to find is to switch to the gz format (https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/316).  Is it possible to submit a PR for this and switch the archive type to gz for the gettext package?
